properties.areaDesc: Johnston; Pontotoc; Marshall; Atoka; Bryan; Coal; Hughes
properties.headline: Flood Watch issued January 9 at 4:06AM CST until January 11 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Norman OK
properties.description:
...Heavy rainfall expected...

.A storm system will bring heavy rainfall to southeastern
Oklahoma Friday afternoon through Friday evening. Some areas of
flooding and flash flooding will be possible.

The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a

* Flood Watch for flash flooding...flooding of creeks and
rivers...and flooding of low lying areas for portions of east
central Oklahoma and southeast Oklahoma, including the
following areas, in east central Oklahoma, Pontotoc. In
southeast Oklahoma, Atoka, Bryan, Coal, Hughes, Johnston, and
Marshall.

* From Friday afternoon through Friday evening

* Heavy rainfall up to 3 or 4 inches may cause urban and small
stream flooding as well as possible flash flooding.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on
current forecasts.

You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible
Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be
prepared to take action should flooding develop.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING
